title: TRIC Network Workshop
text:
Talk on AI across the research life cycle



Gain some understanding and (hopefully) intuition how how AI systems work and how to appraise them.



How LLM’s have changed over the last few years and how to use them more effectively.

title: The Good, The Bad and The Necessary:
The Good, The Bad and The Necessary:
text:
The Bad

‘…we developed a series of prompts in an iterative, sequential format…. In this approach, the researcher designed sequential prompts based on the assessment of the previous responses generated by GPT-4, starting from a general prompt, and designing subsequent prompts to refine the output toward the desired form.’
— A study that shall remain nameless

title: The Good, The Bad and The Necessary:

The Good, The Bad and The Necessary:
text:
The Necessary

Adopt electronic healthcare records
Standardize data formats and codes
Implement real-time data validation
Deploy automated data-cleansing tools
Utilize machine learning for data anomaly detection

    Alan Turing, 1950

title: Clinical Artificial Intelligence
section: You probably use it every day
text: You probably use it every day

title: Clinical Artificial Intelligence
text:
AI? Deep Learning? Machine learning?

van der Meijden SL et al. Possibilities and challenges for artificial intelligence and machine learning in perioperative care. BJA Education; 2023; DOI: 10.1016/j.bjae.2023.04.003

title: Clinical Artificial Intelligence
text:
Unsupervised learning














used stroke volume index, heart rate, cardiac index, systemic vascular resistance index, and pulse pressure variation measurements
myocardial depression
bradycardia
vasodilation with cardiac index increase
vasodilation without cardiac index increase
hypovolaemia
mixed type.

title: Clinical Artificial Intelligence
section: How do computers find the right weights?
text:
How do computers find the right weights?

Weights are the numbers we can adjust to make the model fit the data
They are random to begin with
They try and minimise a ‘loss function’

Make the squares smaller!

Gradient descent tells them the direction and magnitude to change

title: Clinical Artificial Intelligence
text:
Key takeaways

\(y = m.x+c\)
You can only change 2 things in linear regression
You can do an awful lot with this

Original POSSUM model has 19 variables
3 ‘weights’ in the final model
Around 30 in NELA Risk Calculator

title: Clinical Artificial Intelligence
section: What does a revolution look like?
text: What does a revolution look like?

title: Clinical Artificial Intelligence
text:
The black box





Schnider model - space state equation from: https://www.fc.up.pt/galeno/Models/Schnider%20Model%20-%20Pro.pdf

title: Clinical Artificial Intelligence
text:
Everything you’ve learn before applies

The jargon is a tiny fraction of the paper
What have they ACTUALLY studied?

Is it what/who I’m interested in?

Is it clear what the model is actually predicting or discovering?

Is that what you are interested in?

title: Clinical Artificial Intelligence
text:
Summary

AI is a broad term.

Machine learning and deep learning are more specific

It’s not that different to covnentional statistics

But the scale is difficult to comprehend

It will change healthcare

When? Who knows

Be excited, be sceptical
